Im Moment ist unsere Produktion ziemlich low-tech. Wir machen alles von Hand, aber wir haben begonnen, unseren Rhythmus zu finden, um effizient mit unserer Zeit und Energie umzugehen. 

Diese Mischung wird in spezielle Pilzbeutel gefüllt und dann pasteurisiert, bevor sie geimpft wird. Ab diesem Zeitpunkt werden wir in etwa 5 Wochen frische Pilzlinge haben.

node.text:
And she's up! It feels strange not to have shed any blood, sweat or tears over this one but I can get over that. I highly recommend having the experts build it.

Next we will fill her up with compost and get the rows ready for early spring greens, then tomatoes, cucumbers and peppers and some fall/ winter greens.

Season extension is key in our region so the Natural Resource Conservation Service  @nrcs_ny Grants for high tunnels like these are a game changer. This beauty will allow us to extend our season to the end of December next year! Progress. 

#seasonextension #nrcsny #progress #buildingafarm #newfarm #season2 #smallscalefarming #organicveggies #orangecountyny #nyfarm #bloomingburgny

node.text: Reason # 738 why I love growing flowers: it forces me to learn patience. It’s all about timing, waiting, and preparing. I’ll happily wait all year long for a few months of beautiful harvest because the joy in the reward is worth it every time. 🌰🌱🌷

node.text:
Our renowned Simplest Turkey includes a stuffed turkey breast, a stuffed turkey leg, sausages wrapped in bacon and a pouch of our pure turkey stock - everything you need to make a proper festive feast 💫

You can choose from our three delicious festive stuffings 🦃 Pictured is our Free Range Sage & Onion Simplest Turkey, equally delicious hot or cold, so remember to have some leftovers for a really simple and tasty Boxing Day lunch or supper.

"This was the second year we have ordered this and it's just excellent, the meat is tender, full of flavour and the stock supplied is brilliant. Combined with the roasting juices it makes lovely gravy. We will definitely buy this again." - Nicky W

We don’t have many delivery slots left before Christmas, so if you’re looking for a simpler Christmas meal, shop online today at pipersfarm.com ✨

node.text:
“Planting the Spring garden is one of my favorite days of the year. There’s something about growing your own food that feels so wonderful, especially during times like these.” - @the_frenchiefarm

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @the_frenchiefarm

“Frenchie Farm is an organic and regenerative family farm raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, Great Pyrenees, and pasture raised chickens, ducks, and broiler chickens. We provide farm classes for kids dedicated to teaching children about sustainable farming. Frenchie Farm also sells seasonally appropriate farm-to-table goods, including but not limited to, pasture raised chicken + duck eggs, pasture raised broiler chickens, honey, and seasonal produce.”

In an effort to live a more simplified life with intention and gratitude, our family made the decision to pursue modern homesteading. We grow as much of our own food as possible in our garden while also raising Nigerian Dwarf goats, chickens, and bees.”

Chicago, Illinois
📸: @the_frenchiefarm

node.text:
Cooking Christmas dinner can often be a stressful affair, wrestling over oven space and trying to get your bird cooked just right, can bring even the hardiest cook out in a cold sweat.

Let us introduce you to our ‘Simplest Turkey’ 🦃✨

This unique concept allows you to offer every guest a selection of white and brown meat (leg and breast), rolled separately and stuffed with your choice of festive stuffing. It is designed to be cooked easily, in one pan, in one hour alongside our more-ish Saddleback sausages wrapped in streaky bacon - a Christmas essential.

Choose from:
Free Range Apricot & Hazelnut Simplest Turkey
Free Range Cranberry & Hazelnut Simplest Turkey (Pictured)
Free Range Sage & Onion Simplest Turkey

Delivery slots are almost gone for Christmas, so order online today at pipersfarm.com for an breezy but beautiful Christmas day meal ✨

#bronzeturkey #christmasturkey #turkey #freerangeturkey #heritageturkey #devon #slowgrownturkey #slowfood #freerange #heritagebird #highwelfareturkey #animalwelfare #familyfarm #slowfarming #onlinebutcher #artisanbutcher #smallscalefarming #regenerativefarming #turkeysimplest #simplestturkey

node.text:
We have been blown away once again by your incredible support this Christmas. Our Whole Turkey & Goose have flown straight out the door. But we do have a handful of festive feasts left available for you to order, including our Simplest Turkey, Native Breed 100% Grass Fed Beef and a selection of Christmas Trimmings.

There are just a handful of delivery slots left this year.

If you would like a Pipers Farm Christmas this year, please place your order as soon as possible, as once the slots are gone, they really are gone!

We do not say this lightly, but trust us when we say that if you are looking for a super simple Christmas, look no further than our Simplest Turkey, a lovingly rolled and stuffed bird that cooks in one pan in just one hour 🦃  

Shop online today at pipersfarm.com for an easy-peasy but delicious Christmas meal ✨

node.text:
I am RE-OPENING SATTIN HILL FARM and leaving Raleigh City Farm at the end of this year. This is a very tough decision, but ultimately it's what's best for me and my family.

I am very grateful for the opportunity that Raleigh City Farm has provided for me and the interns/volunteers. We have learned and accomplished a lot.

Sattin Hill Farm V2.0 will be a very small and efficient operation growing veggies exclusively for local chefs. If you would like to hear more about my decision and plans for the farm, please watch today's YouTube video.

If you are a local chef and would like to work together in 2021, please send me a DM. My production plan will be based on what you would like in your restaurant.

Also, I hope to be more active here on IG in the future. I have been pouring most of my energy into Raleigh City Farm and my YouTube channel during 2020.

I would also like to take a moment to thank all of you for your support over the past few years. I look forward to sharing more sustainable farming and my story with you.

node.text:
Soil Blocking

Yesterday, amidst some getting ready for Christmas, little miss and I also made some soil blocking mix before everything gets frozen solid.

I loved the concept of soil blocking when I first learned of them about 5 years ago. You are literally growing your plants in soil, which hugely reduces plastic and can help decrease transplanting shock. However, I have had some good successes with them but also some big frustrations. So now I do a hybrid of some soil blocking and some plastic trays with inserts.

Transplants that don't spend much time in the seedling room or stay relatively small will mostly be started in soil blocks in the upcoming season and things that  are in longer and get quite large will go in trays. 

Most seeds aren't started until at least March, however I am growing eucalyptus again this year and trying the beautiful lisianthus and both of those will be started before January 1st! 

So at some point soon, my wreath making workshop will be put away and I will get it ready for seed starting. 

So it won't be long until I start documenting seed starting I guess! But for now, I am having fun getting ready for Christmas with the kids and tons of puppy training!!
The Food Plot salad bar! 🥬 Certainly is salad weather 🙌 ☀️ Jump online and place your order before 12 midday TOMORROW!

node.text:
Why not put all your eggs in one basket?! We certainly love this beautiful collection @heartandhammock has gathered! Here are a few of our best tips for egg collection:
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
🥚 How many times a day should you gather eggs? If possible, plan to gather eggs 2-3 times per day. At a minimum, gather in the morning and evening.
🥚 What do you do with cracked eggs? Discard eggs with cracks - these imperfections allow bacteria to enter the egg. 
🥚 To wash or not to wash? It depends on how you plan to store them. Washing removes the protective cuticle layer that helps keep bacteria out. Unwashed eggs may be stored on the counter, but if you wash them, ensure they are refrigerated to prevent contamination.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
What advice would you add when it comes to collecting and storing your chicken eggs?

node.text:
It’s young Oli’s birthday today. With his quick wit, loyalty, steadfast reliability and huge heart, he’s always ready to lend a hand digging garden beds or pull you into line (as I’m sure he’s doing in this photo).
He’s a loving (and authoritarian) uncle and regardless of the ten years between him and Dan, he’s a best friend as well as a brother.
We all miss having him here while he’s up in Perth studying to be a high school teacher, where he will no doubt give those kids a run for their money.
Happy birthday, Ol 🧡
@oliver.kay_

node.text:
Summer on the small holding seems busy, always fettling bits and bobs, maintaining the pastures and carrying out occasional animal husbandry tasks but dark winter days bring a real long hard slog! 😅 The daily jobs lists seems to grow at an exponential rate and all the jobs are done by moonlight! 🌙 This is also the first year we have kept some sheep inside (more on that to come!) so we are even busier than usual! It certainly tests your dedication 😂 but we all know it's worth it, after all how could you refuse such a beautiful face? 🐑💕

*for the eagle eyed amongst you, yes this photo is a couple of weeks old, the trees are now completely bare 🍂

#shetlandsheep #rarebreed #smallholding #smallbusiness #smallscalefarming #sheep #sunny #britishfarming #lincolnshire #englishcountryside

node.text:
Cultivating creativity. During the growing season I love putting plans into action but I've found it helps to first physically draw the ideas I dream up in my head. It also makes it easier to run these ideas by my skilled builder, which tends to improve the design. These scribbles are the shelving design for the chicken coop/greenhouse. I'm glad we waited to finish this project until we got experience using the structure through three seasons. Improvising shelving this past summer and fall allowed me to play around with placement and better understand the importance of modular shelving that works in all seasons (including when we turn the greenhouse back over to the chickens for the winter). I am also excited to see if storing our extra bee equipment in the coop will keep it mouse-free!
#cultivatingcreativity #greenhousedesign #coopdesign #greenhousechickencoop #maketimefordesign #winterproject #micearejerks #smallscalefarming #farmher

node.text:
This month’s Journal post is now up on our website, and it focuses on our incredible food suppliers.

All are small farms based in Ontario, all are within 200km of Avling, and all are going through the most unexpected year of their careers! Read the roundtable discussion at the link in our bio.

If you’re signed up for our newsletter, you’ll receive an advance copy of our Journal each month, as well as exclusive information about beer releases and special offers. Sign up at www.avling.ca and be the first to be in the know!

node.text:
This @givingtuesday we hope you will partner with us to help hard working women farmers make the most of their harvests through our food preservation technology and training. 
Not only does this ensure families can store enough food for themselves throughout the dry season, but provides a steady source of income through the sale of preserved produce year round. 🙌🙌🙌
#preserveinternational #preservefood #preservedignity #preservehope #womenfarmers #smallscalefarming #foodpreservation #sustainableagriculture #womensupportingwomen #empowerwomen #empowerfarmers #womenrunbusiness #bidibidirefugeesettlement #yumbe #uganda

Support PACSAC: reason #2
.
When the pandemic hit and restaurants closed, many local farms redirected their crops to CSA shares.  For many farmers, it was the first time they had run a CSA program.  PACSAC helped farmers figure out those details 
.
At the same time, many people realized that local food and short supply chains were an added layer of safety against the virus.
.
PACSAC was the critical link that helped connect people with their farmers.  Over 50,000 people used our online directory to find their CSA share.
.
We need your help to keep this service available next year.  Please consider a small donation to PACSAC thi giving week. 
.
Plus, every donor is entered into a raffle for a winter CSA box!
.
Link in bio. 🙏🏻
.
#PACSAC #PNWCSA #communitysupportedagriculture #csa #sustainableagriculture #eatlocal #eatrealfood #smallscalefarming #smallfarms #youarewhatyoueat #givingweek

node.text:
Less than 24 hours left to register for the Regenerative Earth Summit - it starts tomorrow at 10am MT!⁠
⁠
In the spirit of #nationalgivesday tomorrow, we have donation-only tickets available for the summit. We invite you to support and engage in the efforts of Regenerative Rising, a 501c3 nonprofit organization based in Colorado, by donating what you can to join us at the Regenerative Earth Summit tomorrow and Wednesday, December 1-2.⁠
⁠
Whether you are a student, sustainability professional, mother or father, entrepreneur, consultant, land steward etc...if you have hope for a regenerative future we invite you to join us for this highly engaging virtual summit to learn from regenerative leaders around the globe! ⁠
⁠
Let's connect, inspire, and support each other in this collective work regenerating the Earth. Please support with a generous heart at the level you feel comfortable. Your donation is 100% tax-deductible. Donate & register in the link in our bio!⁠
⁠

node.text:
A big thank you to everyone who has placed an order so far this year. Your support is hugely appreciated 🙏🏻

Our turkeys arrive as poults in May, with us having decided on numbers in February. They are then allowed to slowly grow to full maturity over the next 7 months, free ranging across our pastures.

Even on a normal year, turkey farming can present many challenges and it takes many years of experience to be able to rear our turkeys to naturally be a range of sizes & weights, just in time for Christmas.

We are so grateful for your support this year, whether as one of our fantastic customers who buys from us year after year, or giving us a try for the first time.

It’s been a busy weekend for orders, and so we are now sold out of our smallest whole turkeys and all geese. We still have medium & larger sizes of whole turkeys available, crowns (including a new larger size), breast roasts (also with a new larger size!) as well as legs, wings & turkey sausages.

You can also order goose fat for making the best roast potatoes and cranberry jelly too 🙌🏻

As ever, orders may be placed via our online shop and we have collection points across Kent as well as here at the farm.

And if you need any help at all with your order, do get in touch on 01580 291792 or info@kentturkeys.co.uk

📷: @saltwickmedia

node.text:
It’s a tough job sampling GFM Editor Ann Mefferd’s fermented hot sauce trial, but someone’s got to do it!

When she puts on her other cape to run Seedlings by Annie at One Drop Farm, she starts 40-50 varieties of peppers for seedling customers every year. Some of them are so hot you can’t exactly take a bite out of them, so she made a simple fermented sauce out of the really hot ones to get an idea of the flavor and heat that you can actually eat. So far the lemon drop pepper is really good, we’ll let you know if we find any new favorites!

-posted by GFM Editor Andrew Mefferd @growingformarketmagazine

node.text:
In this episode we look at how to grow popcorn shoots, or popcorn microgreens, I go through how to grow these from start to finish, and I let you in on the secret to getting them that beautiful yellow colour.
▫️
Link in bio 👆
▫️
By the end of the episode you'll have the knowledge to grow these yourself. 
▫️
In this episode you'll learn:
1️⃣How to grow popcorn shoots.
2️⃣Their seed density and yield weight
3️⃣How to get them to grow yellow in colour.
4️⃣An alternative use for popcorn seeds.
5️⃣How to pick the right moment to harvest them.
.
.
. 
.
.
.
.
.
. 
#microgreens #microgreens🌱 #alwayslearning 
#urbangardening #entrepreneur #microgreensbusiness #smallbusinessowner #growmicrogreensforprofit #microgreensfarmtotable #urbanfarming #microgreenspodcast #podcast #ebook #indoorfarming #growyourownfood #sustainability #microfarm #farmfresh #organic #smallscalefarming #plantbased #businessopportunity #locallygrown #eatlocal #growyourown #howtogrowmicrogreens #homebusiness #startupbusiness #beyourownboss #entreprenurial

AMAZING news! Yesterday was our farm’s biggest single day of member signups to our Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) since we started in 2015! We only have a few spots left in our Winter CSA membership that will likely be gone by the end of the day. 

If you join right now for as little as $18/week on our website - link in bio - you will be guaranteed a spot in our winter CSA from December 11-April 11! Try us out with our 30-day no-risk money-back satisfaction guarantee. Today, Monday, November 30th, is our LAST DAY to get 10% off the whole season! Go to https://www.maplebloomfarm.ca/pages/local-food-box-csa

With a week left in our planned registration period, filling up this quickly was beyond our wildest expectations. If you go to our website to sign up and we are already sold out, please email Farmer Jordan at jordan@maplebloomfarm.ca to be added to our waiting list, and you’ll be the first to hear if a space opens up.

As a CSA member, you will have exclusive access to over 40 local food items to choose from every week from our own farm and our partner producers across PEI — lettuce mix, tomatoes, fresh-baked bread, cucumbers, carrots, free range eggs, greens, fair trade coffee, potatoes, meat, shoots and microgreens and MUCH more available for free pickup any day of the week at Founders’ Food Hall & Market, next-day ordering, and weekly home delivery (FREE for all seniors and any weekly order over $50)! 

Eating great and local in winter on PEI is now easier than its ever been. :)

Thank you for supporting your local farmers and food producers!

Join now at https://www.maplebloomfarm.ca/pages/local-food-box-csa

Efter at have ligget på varmt og mørkt på hemsen i 3 uger, er der nu kommet en del røde tomater fra de grønne frilandstomater som blev plukket for et par uger siden 😁 Dog gik halvdelen også til I processen 🤷🏼‍♂️

Men det er da helt vildt fedt at man bare kan smide de sidste tomater til eftermodning. Sidste år spiste vi de sidste tomater helt hen i januar 😅
.
.

node.text:
Free Online Farming Course
http://www.agricademyinc.org/beta

If you live in the Cincinnati, OH Tri-State area and are interested in learning about starting a small scale farming operation Agricademy Inc. has a free course starting in January 2021. Course enrollees will be selected from the responses to the form. This is not a gardening class. 

To be considered for this course you must meet the following criteria:

-Must be a minimum of 10 years old and up (we have a youth and adult cohort)
-Must identify as Black or African American
-Must live in the Cincinnati Tri-State Area
-All classes will take place online. 

Only 100 people total will be enrolled. Please respond to the form by December 15. 2020.
#urbanfarmsista #blacksinagriculture #teachthehood #smallscalefarming #cincinnati #uwgc #blackempowerment #blackempowermentthroughagriculture

We believe in ... 👉🏽

node.text:
I don’t think I needed to worry about our lettuces and spinach, but since I hadn’t taken our recycling in a while, I had a lot of milk cartons stocked up to use as coverings. Thanks @millkingmilk! They did well for round 1 of freezing temperatures, but our green bean plants are looking a little droopy. I’m not sure if they’ll make another round of freezing let alone bounce back from this one. I don’t have any special coverings for them. I read you’re not supposed to use plastic to cover them though. Maybe I have a few sheets to spare? Any other suggestions?

node.text:
Monday Mornings - Rambo Radish is looking great for their delivery this Wednesday. This new partner’s main focus was “reliability and consistency.”

Growing indoors in a controlled environment in small batches allows us to fine tune each crop to our grow space. 

The rest are for our partner who wanted fresh weekly deliveries for their family. They’re busy with various aged kids - the sunflowers were a hit and fresh wheatgrass was something they were missing in their busy schedules.

As always... 
We’re still growing. 
~⁠
Enjoy locally grown microgreens delivered fresh to you. 
Visit our website and schedule your first delivery. Delivering to Santa Barbara, Goleta, Montecito,Carpinteria, & Gaviota, California.⁠
HELP US GET TO 1K FOLLOW --> @sbmicrogreens
⁠

node.text:
The causes of food insecurity and world hunger are more complex than they sound. The solution does not simply include increasing production of food or dumping food aid on food insecure populations. The solution requires looking at the overall economy and making some structural changes. 

Swipe through to see how much of the worlds population is impacted by this, and what anyone can do to help!

•

•

•

node.text: We are finally breaking ground on some new property with the help of our friends @dirt_road_farm. This is a 5,000 ft2 plot, or around 1/8 acre. This, combined with our home plot will almost triple our growing space, with another 10,000 ft2 available on this property. Next we'll come in with a chisel plow and then start  shaping beds and planting cover crops. I definitely need some advice on winter cover crops in south... #smallfarms #localfarms #georgiafarm #microfarm #familyfarm #marketfarm #marketgarden #smallscalefarming #regenerativefarming #biointensive #breakingground #newfarm

node.text:
How come Plant foods are just SO BEAUTIFUL?! I just adore them. 100% want to bring those into my body and let them become me ;)
(ok that sounded a little weird but you know what i mean ..!) 😆
.
Gorge produce this week from @nourishedcommunities – who, if you are local to #Islington, #London you’re lucky – these lovely peeps’ well-stocked popup shop open days are steadily increasing (think farm #marketstall + whole food shop + #zerowasteshop combined!)
.
I just love seeing small, passionate initiatives like these take foot and steadily grow stronger as people around them understand just how lucky they are to get access to this kind of produce. And just how much small businesses like these bring to a local area 👊 #shoplocalforthewin #londonlockdown2
.
Much love, Sara x
#shisodelicious

node.text:
This week we are happy to share with you @sullifarmandkitchen 👩‍🌾 They strive to build community around food, to have relationships with the families that consume their product.  They want you to know where your food comes from, how it was produced, how it affects you, and how it affects the environment around you. 💛

@farmstandrevival’s NEWEST Featured Farm: 👍 @sullifarmandkitchen

“Here at Sullifarm, we embrace a rather full-circle scene in agriculture.  One that’s all about restoration, repair, healing and health.  We don’t just grow food, we strive to regenerate our soils and pastures in the process. 
.
Pasture-raising animals according to their natures thus creating the tastiest and healthiest food products in a local and regenerative farm setting.”

Hooks, TX
📸: @sullifarmandkitchen

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by 🍇Garden Community🍇 on November 26, 2020. Image may contain: outdoor.

node.text: We have been so busy getting the farm ready for winter but I’m happy to say we got the new greenhouse up and running right before the first snowfall of the season. It’s not perfect but I’m proud of how it came out and happy to have more space for our #microgreens 🌱Building a greenhouse from scratch was the easy part, growing in Tahoe during the winter will be the challenging part. 🌱🌱🌱 #HighAltitudeFarming
